msItem.title: Pentitential psalms
msItem.incipit: Domine ne in furore tuo arguas me
msItem.explicit: Et perdes omnes qui tribulant animam meam: quoniam ego servus tuus sum. Gloria patri.

msItem.title: Office of the Virgin
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt cursus de domina nostra. Ad Matutinas.
msItem.explicit: ab instantibus malis et a morte perpetua liberemur.

msItem.title: Celebrants' prayers before saying Mass
msItem.incipit: Adiutorium nostrum in nomine domini qui fecit celum et terram

layout.p: Ruled in ink, one column, 16 lines, written space: 70 x 45 mm.

decoNote.p: Three initials in blue with white void decoration and red pen flourishes on f. 3r (4 lines in height), 19r (5 lines in height) and 66r (7 lines in height). Small wavy vegetable line-filler in mauve on f. 66r.
Style: The composition and the dense leafy decoration is consistent with Dutch manuscripts from the mid 15th century.

foliation.p: Foliated continuously 1-92 (ff. 1-2 and 89 are parchement flyleaves, ff. 90-92 are paperleaves added later) in pencil in the upper right corner by the modern cataloguer.

additions.p: On ff. 1v-2v there are liturgical instructions in a cursive hand and on ff. 90r-92r there are prayers added in a later cursive hand.

acquisition.p: The manuscript was owned by Jacob Pontusson De la Gardie (1768-1842) whose ex libris is on the inside of the upper cover. It came to the University library as part of the Löberöd archives in 1848. There are several former shelf marks both in the inside of the upper cover and on f. 1r (cfr. above).

recordHist.source: Catalogued September of 2005 by Eva Nilsson Nylander.
